etymology.description: 皿(皿) (mǐn, "container") + 𠂤(果) (guǒ, phonetic component) = container-like object + phonetic element -> helmet
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the idea of a container and a phonetic element that suggests sound. Helmets resemble containers that fit over the head, and the phonetic component 𠂤(果) (guǒ) provides the pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 士兵戴着坚固的盔(士兵戴著堅固的盔)。
examples.pinyin: Shìbīng dài zhe jiāngù de kuī.
examples.english: The soldier wears a sturdy helmet.

examples.chinese: 骑士举起闪亮的盔(騎士舉起閃亮的盔)，走向战场(走向戰場)。
examples.pinyin: Qíshì jǔ qǐ shǎnliàng de kuī, zǒuxiàng zhànchǎng.
examples.english: The knight raised his shiny helmet and headed to the battlefield.

examples.chinese: 古代将领佩戴华丽的盔(古代將領佩戴華麗的盔)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài jiānglǐng pèidài huálì de kuī.
